I came across this game "Besiege" and though it might appeal to some KSP players.

You get to design and build giant siege engines and then let them wreak havoc.

There is a second game "Offworld Trading Company" that might be fun.

I wish it was more science based as it seems more economic.

Both are early access and I'm holding off on this one to see how it develops.
I bought beseige about 30 seconds after I saw it. Pretty fun for how unfinished it is still

I got it about a week ago week ago... and even though ive finished all the levels im still playing it.

I love going on the subreddit for it (/r/besige) and seeing others creations, one of the top posts is a flamethrower .... torture machine and another is 2 people 'going at it' and then one of them exploding. I mean what else could you want.

OH AND DID I MENTION THE $7 PRICE TAG?!

BTW, NerdCubed has played it, and Jacksepticeye and EnterElysium have done several videos on it as well. All the videos are great, really show the stuffy you can do. Two days ago my friend came over and made a gigantic lawnmower with about 15 cannons and 16 flamethrowers.

This game paid for itself. When I bought it, within the first 10 minutes my comp would shut down due to heat. Opened it up, turns out the exhaust fan had a big lump of dust in it and the vanes were so dusty they turned the cotton swabs I was cleaning them with black. Cleaned all the dust, now instead of 130 F (54 C) my comp runs at 95 F (35 C). Thanks Besieged!
